What Yousaf said about YK you remember well but he also had some nice words to say about Malik.

- MoYo wanted to become Captain but PCB made Malik captain. MoYo was angry on PCB but could not do much but cursing Malik.

- Malik revealed the Oath saga to Aaqib and MoYo was the hero.

- Malik made fun (openly) of MoYo in Australia and MoYo was furious about him.

(Malik was never in MoYo's good books so we can understand MoYo's outbursts)

- MoYo and YK were seniors and close (MoYo used to consult YK during and after ICL days). So we have to pay attention if MoYo says something about YK,

^ W63L35

That post never meant to single you only. I said Islam teaches us to love. I don't think BlackZero hates Shoaib Malik or anyone for that matter.

Keep loving, lovers? It's better to love than to hate. We are literally divided in Pakistan because of similar reason which leads to Sunni-Shia, Sindhi-Punjabi...etc. I have understood that no matter what happens, but we can't hate for the sake of unity of Islamic brotherhood even if we put our personal issues aside.

What makes you think how i changed? Ask anyone - before 2009, i literally used to criticize anyone particularly Shahid Khan Afridi (some may say criticisms were warranted back then), but as soon as i have changed, i have regretted it big time, and somehow, i was struggling to put like/dislike aside, but i kept praying to Allaah (SWT) and always have asked help from Allaah (SWT) to make me humble, and remove the hatred that is inside my heart. Finally, i have changed. All Praises belong to Allaah (SWT). This literally changed my life. People, my friends, are surprised how i manage to keep my life so simple. I am happy inside as much as i am happy outside.

I have never meant to judge you. You just said keep loving, lovers? Let BlackZero love. LOL

It's better than anything. I love everyone including Afridi and Younus Khan. Someone may misunderstand me though. It's understandable. Khush Raha kar! Life is too short!

^ Saeed Sohail -

Assalamu Alaikum, Kaisay ho!

I do prefer him over Younus Khan, but Younus Khan will always be world class player to me, after Mohammad Yousuf. Third best thing happened to Pakistan after Inzimam and Yousuf, Alhamdulillah!

I prefer Pietersen, but i never mean to hate Younus Khan though. Both Younus Khan and Afridi are my favorite players. Just because i say Afridi shouldn't play Test, and neither should Younus Khan should - for ODI/T20. That doesn't mean i hate them.

I only say as per cricket perspective.

^ BlackZero

I don't remember BlackZero hating Younus Khan. He does have a point about him - shouldn't be playing in ODI/T20. He does acknowledge that Younus Khan is world class player though. I have read one of his post about Younus Khan. I don't remember when. May Allaah (SWT) forgives me if i am wrong.

Take Care - See You All in this thread at next week, Insha'Allaah!

Last edited: Feb 5, 2012

He'll be back. Too many average ODI players in the side like Farhat, Younis, perhaps even Hammad Azam (who in my opinion hasn't warranted an inclusion based on domestic form, more on his U19 form which is a different ball park altogether).

If we move on from those, and go ahead and pick good ODI (or at least the potential) cricketers like Asad Shafiq, Azhar ali, Fawad alam, Jamal Anwar among others than Malik will be kept out for good. Pick guys who could quite possibly average around or over 40 in ODIs in the future. Guys like Younis won't (and hasn't been a force in ODIs for a long time), Farhat won't, Adnan won't ( could turn out a decent test wicketkeeper batsmen, but don't think he'll do great in ODIs).

One of the reasons why Malik came back in the first place.

Mediocres replacing mediocres is not the way to go, I hope for the sake of Pakistan the new inclusions do well in the series to block any possibility of reentering the tried and tested mediocrities in the team.

That's what I'm saying.

Don't think Fawad Alam or Asad Shafiq are mediocre though. Asad was doing very well, starting to average 40 or so last year and bringing that average up after a bad start. And then was dropped. He can well increase his average given more games he was heading in the right direction. As for Fawad, the guy was already averaging like 37 despite playing lower down which didn't suit him. If given a consistent string of games, I could see him averaging over 40.

That's what I'm saying.

Don't think Fawad Alam or Asad Shafiq are mediocre though. Asad was doing very well, starting to average 40 or so last year and bringing that average up after a bad start. And then was dropped. He can well increase his average given more games he was heading in the right direction. As for Fawad, the guy was already averaging like 37 despite playing lower down which didn't suit him. If given a consistent string of games, I could see him averaging over 40.

I am fawad's biggest supporter and I truly believe he should be in both squads (if not in the test team). He can replace Younis khan in odi's and can be in the test squad for bench strength and be back once the seniors start to retire. At the moment the one day side is full of one paced players (hafeez only looks agressive but has the strike rate of 74 after his return) Imran farhat(the less said the bettet , asad ,misbah , younis are all one paced players. Umar Akmal is the only reliable (only just) aggressor and after him it is all hit and miss. In one days we need a bit of aggression or better strike roatation (80 + strike rate).

OMG ... BZ....

Now the REAL/HONEST/TRUE Congratulations!!!

Awais Zia is the only new face in Pakistan's limited-overs squads for the ongoing series against England. The Rawalpindi batsman has been named only in the Twenty20 squad, while the one-day unit retains the bulk of the Test team, except for Taufeeq Umar and Mohammad Talha, who will return home. Shahid Afridi, Shoaib Malik and batsman Hammad Azam will join the squad in the UAE. Malik was not in the original squads but was added shortly after at the captain Misbah-ul-Haq's request.

If Misbah is wrong and Malilk flops yet again (about 508th time).... then Misbah can not keep asking for him over and over again. eventually he has to give in to the pressure of media, public and selector.

Post of the Week

Actually I am disappointed that he left PU in their do or die match against Sind.

He is playing for Pakistan, it's his personal loss but gain for Pakistan...so I support this decision (as Pakistan first)

When has it ever been Pakistan first for you? You wished Pakistan would lose in the world cup. Again you wish Pakistan to lose so we realise the value of Malik.

Bet Malik doesn't feel anything about losing $150K. If you have to give credit to the man, he's always stated and displayed his willingness and eagerness to play in the pakistan team (when he was dropped from the ODI side, he went to domestic and really worked hard to earn his place back in the team. Was very commendable, some may have just given up or content with churning out just average performances). Bet the guy's thrilled just being part of the international side/squad again and that he has another chance to prove himself. Personally I don't think he should be given another chance now, he was given chances he's failed and we should try out others. But I do like the fact he's still trying to get back into the international side, time is on his side, and that's how things should be, it keeps things competitive.

Sometimes I feel you're putting Malik in a bad light with your support. Malik recognises and publically stated he didn't perform up to the mark when he's not done well (while you argue every innings of 20 something is matchwinning when it comes to malik, but not other players). He's stated that he struggles with bouncy pitches and is trying to work on that (which you do't admit, and don't give credit to players who are playing better than malik on bouncy pitches). What's more I don't get the impression that Malik did want Pakistan to lose the world cup at all, and seemed generally interested in Pakistan's efforts despite not playing in it. While you wanted Pakistan to lose. What's more you don't even seem to want to watch matches if Malik's not playing in them.

Bet Malik wouldn't received half of the hatful posts towards malik on here, if you'd been a bit more level headed and less fanatical in your support towards malik.
